channel.title: Android
channel.description:
Well Android as defined by google is
The Open Handset Alliance, a group of more than 30 technology and mobile companies, developed Android: the first complete, open, and free mobile platform.
Its incorporated into the new tmobile G1 heres the documentation for you [url=http://code.google.com/android/documentation.html]http://code.google.com/android/documentation.html[/url] you can download the Android SDK here [url=http://code.google.com/android/download.html]http://code.google.com/android/download.html[/url] Installation guide [url=http://code.google.com/android/intro/installing.html]http://code.google.com/android/intro/installing.html[/url] enjoy!

Its not 100% like the iphone… Better IMO the keyboard is the main feature I like and the open source is fun

im not an apple fan boy but i did want an itouch and im lazy and cbf to carry round phone and itouch so i was thinking of getting the iphone, so its easier to carry round. But if the G1 is good enough i would manage to carry both if i had to
